content: This 1969 event marked the first time humans set foot on another celestial body. What was it?

The event you're referring to is the Apollo 11 moon landing. On July 20, 1969, astronauts Neil Armstrong and Edwin "Buzz" Aldrin became the first humans to set foot on the Moon, while Michael Collins orbited above in the command module. This historic achievement was a major milestone in space exploration and a significant victory for the United States during the Space Race with the Soviet Union.
